sen.j: 内膳司（ないぜんし）は、日本の日本の官制において宮内省に属した機関。
sen.e: Naizenshi was an institution belonging to Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household) in Japanese government-regulated organization or facility, etc.
sen.cmt: 「日本の日本の」とあり、一つ削除しました。
sen.e: Naizenshi was an institution belonging to Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household) in Japanese government-regulated organization or facility, etc.
Naizenshi was an institution belonging to Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household) in Japanese government-regulated organization or facility, etc.

sen.j: 和名は「うちのかしわでのつかさ」。
sen.e: The Japanese reading is "uchinokashiwade no tsukasa."
The Japanese reading is 'Uchinokashiwade no tsukasa.'
sen.cmt: Uchinokashiwade no tsukasaとし、シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: The Japanese reading is 'Uchinokashiwade no tsukasa.'

sen.j: 官舎は内蔵寮の南にあった。
sen.e: The government quarters were in the south side of Kuraryo (Bureau of Palace Storehouses).
The government quarters were in the south side of Kuraryo (Bureau of Palace Storehouses).
The government quarters were in the south side of Kuraryo (Bureau of Palace Storehouses).
The classification of tsukasa was Daishi.
The classification of tsukasa was Daishi.
The classification of tsukasa was Daishi.
Official duties.
Official duties
Official duties

sen.j: 大宝律令以前は膳職という官司であったが、大宝律令制定時に、饗宴における食事の調理と配膳を担当する大膳職と分かれて、天皇の日常における食事の調理と配膳および食料の調達を担当する官司として設立された。
sen.e: Before Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), it was a government official called zenshiki, but when Taiho Ritsuryo was formulated it was divided into naizenshi and daizenshi which cooked and served foods in a feast and was established as a government official who cooked, served and delivered foods for Emperor's daily diet.

Before the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), it was a government office called Zenshiki, but when the Taiho Ritsuryo was formulated it was divided into Daizenshiki which cooked and served foods in a feast and Naizenshi which cooked, served and delivered foods for the Emperor's daily diet.
sen.cmt: the Taiho Ritsuryo、Zenshiki、Naizenshi、the Emperor'sとし、government official→government office、daizenshi→Daizenshikiに修正、一部訳文を修正
sen.e: Before the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), it was a government office called Zenshiki, but when the Taiho Ritsuryo was formulated it was divided into Daizenshiki which cooked and served foods in a feast and Naizenshi which cooked, served and delivered foods for the Emperor's daily diet.

sen.j: このように「外」と｢内｣が対になっている機関は他に典薬寮と内薬司などもある。
sen.e: In addition to the institution which had "inside" and "outside" like this, there were Tenyakuryo (the Bureau of Medicine), Naiyakushi (private doctors for the Emperor) and so on.
In addition to the institution which had 'inside' and 'outside' like this, there were Tenyakuryo (the Bureau of Medicine), Naiyakushi (Palace Medical Office) and so on.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、他の「司」の訳に合わせるためNaiyakushiの補足修正 (参照: http://www.unterstein.net/or/docs/JapanRanks.pdf)
sen.e: In addition to the institution which had 'inside' and 'outside' like this, there were Tenyakuryo (the Bureau of Medicine), Naiyakushi (Palace Medical Office) and so on.

sen.j: 時代は下って、寛平八年（896年）には、同じ宮内省被官の園池司を吸収した。
sen.e: Later in 896, it absorbed enchishi in the same Kunaisho hikan (low-level bureaucrat).
Later in 896, it absorbed Enchishi (Gardens and Ponds Office) that belonged to Kunaisho as well.
sen.cmt: Enchishiとし補足追加、「宮内省被官の」の表記を修正
sen.e: Later in 896, it absorbed Enchishi (Gardens and Ponds Office) that belonged to Kunaisho as well.
Betto (an administrator).
Betto (an administrator).
Betto (an administrator).
Naizenshi's betto.
Naizenshi's betto.
Naizenshi's betto.
The fixed number was one.
The fixed number was one.
The fixed number was one.
The official court rank was Sanmi (Third Rank).
The official court rank was Sanmi (Third Rank).
The official court rank was Sanmi (Third Rank).

sen.j: のちに設置され、大納言もしくは中納言が兼職した。
sen.e: Afterwards it was set up and Dainagon (Major Counselor) or Chunagon (middle counselor) concurrently held the post.
Afterwards it was set up and Dainagon (Major Counselor) or Chunagon (middle counselor) concurrently held the post.
sen.cmt: Dainagon, Chunagon→統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: Afterwards it was set up and Dainagon (Major Counselor) or Chunagon (middle counselor) concurrently held the post.
Buzen (the administrator of Imperial Table Office) and Kami.
Buzen (the administrator of Imperial Table Office) and Kami.
Buzen (the administrator of Imperial Table Office) and Kami.

sen.j: 四等官における内膳司の長官（かみ）に相当する。
sen.e: It corresponded to Kami (director) of naizenshi in Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks).
It corresponded to Kami (director) of Naizenshi in Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks).
It corresponded to Kami (director) of Naizenshi in Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks).
The fixed number was two.
The fixed number was two.
The fixed number was two.
The official court rank was Jurokui (Junior Sixth Rank) and Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank).
The official court rank was Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 「従六位正六位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「正六位上」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: The official court rank was Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 内膳司を統括するとともに、試食（毒味）役でもあった。
sen.e: It controlled naizenshi and played a role of poison tester, too.
It controlled Naizenshi and played a role of poison tester, too.
It controlled Naizenshi and played a role of poison tester, too.

sen.j: 内膳司が設置される前から高橋氏（のちの濱島家）・安曇氏が天皇の食膳を担当していたので、両氏が「奉膳」として長官職を担当し、「正」を置かずにいたが、後に、他氏からも長官職が任命されるようになり、その場合、他の氏は「正」を名乗った。
sen.e: Before the establishment of naizenshi the Takahashi clan (later, the Hamashima family) and the Azumi clan were in charge of serving foods to Emperor and both clans were in charge of director post as 'buzen' (the administrator of Imperial Table Office) and 'Kami' was not put, but later the director post was assigned to the other clans, where the other clans identified themselves as 'Kami.'

Before the establishment of Naizenshi the Takahashi clan (later, the Hamashima family) and the Azumi clan were in charge of serving foods to the Emperor and both clans were in charge of the director post as 'buzen' and 'Kami' was not put, but later the director post was assigned to the other clans, where the other clans identified themselves as 'Kami.'
sen.cmt: Naizenshi、the Emperor、the director postとし、既出のためbuzenの補足削除
sen.e: Before the establishment of Naizenshi the Takahashi clan (later, the Hamashima family) and the Azumi clan were in charge of serving foods to the Emperor and both clans were in charge of the director post as 'buzen' and 'Kami' was not put, but later the director post was assigned to the other clans, where the other clans identified themselves as 'Kami.'

sen.j: 以後、高橋・安曇の両氏が長官職を担当した時は「奉膳」を名乗り、（安曇氏は高橋氏との衝突の末、桓武天皇の頃に断絶し、奉膳職は高橋氏の世襲職となった）高橋氏・安曇氏以外の者が長官職を担当したときは「正」を名乗った。
sen.e: After that, when both Takahashi and Azumi clans were in charge of director post, they identified themselves as 'buzen' (after Azumi clan was at strife with Takahashi clan and was extinguished during the time of Emperor Kammu, and thus the position of buzen became seshu shiki (hereditary agency) of Takahashi clan) and when the other clans except for Takahashi and Azumi clans were in charge of director post, they identified themselves as 'Kami.'

After that, when both the Takahashi and Azumi clans were in charge of the director post, they identified themselves as 'buzen' (after the Azumi clan was at strife with the Takahashi clan and was extinguished during the time of Emperor Kanmu, and thus the position of buzen became seshu shiki [hereditary agency] of the Takahashi clan) and when the other clans except for the Takahashi and Azumi clans were in charge of the director post, they identified themselves as 'Kami.'
sen.cmt: the director postとし、the Takahashi and Azumi clans、the Azumi clan、the Takahashi clan、Emperor Kanmuに修正、カッコ表記修正
sen.e: After that, when both the Takahashi and Azumi clans were in charge of the director post, they identified themselves as 'buzen' (after the Azumi clan was at strife with the Takahashi clan and was extinguished during the time of Emperor Kanmu, and thus the position of buzen became seshu shiki [hereditary agency] of the Takahashi clan) and when the other clans except for the Takahashi and Azumi clans were in charge of the director post, they identified themselves as 'Kami.'
Tenzen (suke (assistant director) of naizenshi).
sen.cmt: 「典膳」を、Tenzen (suke (assistant director) of naizenshi)としました。
sen.e: Tenzen (Suke [assistant director] of Naizenshi).
Tenzen (Suke [assistant director] of Naizenshi).

sen.j: 四等官における内膳司の次官（すけ）に相当する。
sen.e: It corresponded to suke (assistant director) of naizenshi in Shitokan.
It corresponded to Suke of Naizenshi in Shitokan.
sen.cmt: Sukeとし、既出のため補足削除、Naizenshiとしました。
sen.e: It corresponded to Suke of Naizenshi in Shitokan.
The fixed number was six.
The fixed number was six.
The fixed number was six.
The official court rank was Jurokui and Jushichii (Junior Seventh Rank).
The official court rank was Jushichiinoge (Junior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 「従六位従七位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「従七位下」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: The official court rank was Jushichiinoge (Junior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade).

Reishi
Reishi

sen.j: 四等官における内膳司の 主典（さかん）に相当する。
sen.e: It corresponded to sakan (secretary) of naizenshi in Shitokan.
It corresponded to Sakan (secretary) of Naizenshi in Shitokan.
It corresponded to Sakan (secretary) of Naizenshi in Shitokan.
The fixed number was one.
The fixed number was one.
The fixed number was one.
The official court rank was Jurokui and Daishoi (Great Initial Rank).
The official court rank was Daihatsuinojo (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 「従六位大初位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「大初位上」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: The official court rank was Daihatsuinojo (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade).
Kashiwadebe (working in the imperial kitchens).
Kashiwadebe (working in the imperial kitchens).
Kashiwadebe (working in the imperial kitchens).

sen.j: 内膳司の職員で官人雑任。
sen.e: They were the officers in naizenshi and Kanjin Zonin (lower-ranking government official).
They were the officers in Naizenshi and Kanjin Zonin (lower-ranking government official).
They were the officers in Naizenshi and Kanjin Zonin (lower-ranking government official).
The fixed number was forty.
The fixed number was forty.
The fixed number was forty.
Hasher.
Hasher.
Served as cook.
sen.cmt: 「調理人として仕えた」と訳しました。

sen.j: また、膳部の中から五畿内諸国の江長（えのおさ）、網曳長（あびきのおさ）という魚を獲る役、および筑摩御厨長（ちくまのみくりやのおさ）という鮒鮨（ふなずし）などの食糧を貢納する役が任命された。
sen.e: Also, from Kashiwadebe, enosa and abiki no osa, who took fish, or Chikuma no mikuriya (manors of Imperial family and powerful shrines) no osa (Chikuma mikuriya director), who dedicated foods like Funa-zushi (crucian carp sushi) and so on, were appointed for some provinces in Gokinai capital region
sen.cmt: 「筑摩御厨長」を、Chikuma no mikuriya (manors of Imperial family and powerful shrines) no osa (Chikuma mikuriya director) としました。
sen.e: Also, from Kashiwadebe, enosa and abiki no osa, who took fish, or Chikuma no mikuriya (manors of Imperial family and powerful shrines) no osa (Chikuma mikuriya director), who dedicated foods like Funa-zushi (crucian carp sushi) and so on, were appointed for some provinces in Gokinai capital region.

Also, from Kashiwadebe, enosa and abiki no osa, who took fish, or Chikuma no mikuriya (manors of Imperial family and powerful shrines) no osa (Chikuma mikuriya director), who dedicated foods like Funa-zushi (crucian carp sushi) and so on, were appointed for some provinces in Gokinai capital region.

sen.j: 他の職員は以下のとおり。
sen.e: The other staffs were as follows.
The other staffs were as follows.
The other staffs were as follows.

sen.j: 官人雑任→使部→官人仕丁→駈使丁
sen.e: Kanjin Zonin => shibe (low rank bureaucrats) => kanjin shicho (a manservant doing odd jobs) => kushicho (servant doing odd jobs).
sen.cmt: 「駈使丁」を、kushicho (servant doing odd jobs)としました。
sen.e: Kanjin Zonin => shibu (low rank bureaucrats) => kanjin shicho (a manservant doing odd jobs) => kushicho (servant doing odd jobs).
Kanjin Zonin => shibu (low rank bureaucrats) => kanjin shicho (a manservant doing odd jobs) => kushicho (servant doing odd jobs).
